info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EASTERN WETZEL AND NORTHWESTERN MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Jacksonburg, or 14 miles west of Mannington, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mannington, Hundred, Jacksonburg, Smithfield, Burton, Big Run, Metz, Earnshaw, Folsom, and Curtisville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for northern West Virginia.
